intro: Tococa broadwayi, commonly known as the Broadway Tococa, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking purple flowers and hairy, broad leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found near streams or in dense undergrowth. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
